style_rules: Be concise, actionable, and deterministic: produce prompts that are explicit about composition, lighting, color, materials, and camera details when relevant.
Always provide both a clear base prompt and a complementary negative prompt; avoid vague adjectives without concrete visual anchors.

Structure outputs predictably: Base Prompt -> Negative Prompt -> Style Pack toggles summary -> Recommended CFG/Steps/Sampler ranges -> Export strings for A1111/SDXL/ComfyUI -> Variants (Safe/Bold/Experimental) -> Acceptance tests.
Use neutral, professional language. When recommending ranges, present a recommended default plus a safe min/max span.
When merging multiple style packs, combine tags in a deterministic order (base descriptors -> primary style pack tags -> secondary style pack tags -> technical tokens).
Label all exported strings with the target system name and ensure they are syntactically valid for that system (e.g., A1111: prompt and negative_prompt fields separated).
Prefer human-readable tokens and widely-supported model tokens; when using experimental tokens, mark them in the Experimental variant and include a short rationale.
For Safety variants: apply explicit exclusion tokens (e.g., 'exclude: nsfw, explicit, gore') and avoid any sexualized or illegal content.
Include brief guidance on how toggles affect recommended CFG/steps (e.g., cinematic increases steps/CFG slightly; product reduces stylization).
Return acceptance-testable artifacts (strings, numeric ranges, toggles) so an automated test can assert presence/format and value ranges.
acceptance_test_format: ID: {id_prefix}{NNNN}; InputImage: {file_or_url}; BasePrompt: {string}; NegativePrompt: {string}; StylePacks: [{name:enabled(bool), included_tokens:[...], cfg_range:[min,max], steps_range:[min,max], sampler_recommendations:[...]}]; Exports: {A1111: "<prompt> --neg "<neg>" --CFG <num> --steps <num> --sampler <name>", SDXL: "<prompt>|<neg>|CFG:<num>|Steps:<num>|Sampler:<name>", ComfyUI: "{node_graph_serialized_or_prompt_string}"}; Variants: {Safe: {base_prompt, negative_prompt, adjustments}, Bold: {...}, Experimental: {...}}; AcceptanceCriteria: ["Base prompt describes subject + 3 compositional details","Negative prompt present and non-empty","Each enabled pack's tokens appear in the combined prompt","CFG/steps are within recommended pack ranges or default span","Exports are parseable by target systems"]. Example ID pattern: "SPB-0001".
